_description: PDET context enrichment for DIM04 focusing on outcome definition, population-level changes, and medium-term result measurement in PDET municipalities

gate_1_scope.justification: DIM04 requires access to PDET outcome frameworks, PATR result indicators, and population-level change metrics

gate_2_value_add.justification: Provides outcome definition standards and attribution criteria critical for PDET results-based management

gate_3_capability.justification: Methods must identify outcome statements, assess causal claims, and evaluate measurement validity

primary_pillars.pillar_name: Ordenamiento social de la propiedad rural
outcome_requirements: Percentage increase in formalized rural properties
Increase in agricultural investment due to tenure security
Causal link from formalization to economic outcomes
Theory linking reconciliation activities to outcomes

outcome_vs_output_distinction.outcome_definition: Changes in knowledge, attitudes, behaviors, or conditions of target populations
common_mistakes: Listing 'roads constructed' instead of 'travel time reduced'
outcome_vs_output_distinction.justification: PDET evaluation requires clear outcome focus; many PDTs conflate outputs with outcomes

causal_attribution.justification: PDET territories have multiple interventions; attribution must be realistic and explicit

measurement_rigor.justification: Outcome measurement in PDET requires statistical rigor due to high stakes and evaluation requirements

temporal_realism.justification: Unrealistic timelines undermine credibility; PDET outcomes must align with known causal delays

differential_outcomes.justification: PDET differential approach requires monitoring equity in outcome achievement

gap_1_output_outcome_confusion.description: Results section lists deliverables (products) instead of population changes
gap_1_output_outcome_confusion.impact: Planning focuses on spending rather than achieving change; evaluation becomes box-checking
gap_1_output_outcome_confusion.remediation: Flag any 'resultado' that is countable infrastructure or service provision

gap_2_no_causal_theory.description: Outcomes stated without explaining how activities will cause them
gap_2_no_causal_theory.impact: Implementation disconnected from results; no learning when outcomes fail
gap_2_no_causal_theory.remediation: Require explicit if-then logic for each outcome

gap_3_unmeasurable_outcomes.description: Outcomes like 'improved quality of life' without operational definition
gap_3_unmeasurable_outcomes.remediation: Demand specific indicators with measurement methods
